title: The Forest: pulp logger
creator_credit: Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
brief_description: The history of the timber industry in Eastern Canada. England deprived of its timber supplies after Napoleon’s conquest of Europe turned to Canada. The move west in America increased the demand for timber, and the advent of newspapers created a need for wood pulp. Today the highly mechanised timber industry makes Canada the largest exporter in the world.
